intro: Antennaria longii, commonly known as the long-stemmed mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit and dense clusters of small, white flowers. The plant features hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is typically found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Antennaria longii is known for its ability to survive in harsh, cold environments, making it a hardy species adapted to high-altitude conditions.
